text: We're getting ready to sell a pretty big enterprise client of ours and I was wondering what the best setup was for Multiple brands that live under one parent Corp ?
Ex: They have a "Master Group LLC" company that owns a bunch of subsidiary brands
Company 1 Company 2 COmpany 3

each with their own mix of domains and subdomains <http://brand1.mastercorp.com|brand1.mastercorp.com>  + <http://brand1.com|brand1.com> <http://brand2.mastercorp.com|brand2.mastercorp.com> + <http://brand2.com|brand2.com>  etc
Would analytics / tracking / profiling work across brand subdomains? How does one handle tracking on a totally separate domain
Assuming Enterprise account for publishing to multiple subdomains

We have clients like that with separate sites AND with enterprise. 

I can’t say it’s better for everything but I’ve found for development it’s seemed a bit better to have separate HS sites. But many of the reasons we had might not be valid anymore. had to do with things like how domain level settings worked and whatnot

To go along with Jon's point, I think it depends on the brand and user experience. We have a parent company with multiple subsidiaries, but the parent company is not customer-facing, so each child company has their own site to avoid unnecessary confusion. Then they just have business rules on the sales side to make sure their CRMs are relatively in alignment, but even that could probably be automated.

On the other hand, if the parent was customer-facing and the child company seems more like a branch of the major brand, it would probably be more suited to a single enterprise situation with subdomains.
Yeah, that's why I'm asking now - I remember that the last time I had to make this sort of recommendation to anyone I basically said "keep them separated"
Thanks <@U7SL518D6> & <@U26BLKGE4> - We're still gathering the requirements but I appreciate the advice
I guess one consideration would be permissions - are they okay with the different sub companies having full control over eachothers sites, if their employees have access to the main account
I think that's going to be one of the biggest concerns with an enterprise account

This is an odd request possibly. I'm trying to work on a script to add my team members via a script in the settings > users & teams. I'm able to programmatically click the create user button, but when I target the email address input  code: document.querySelector('.form-control.user-detail-inputs').value = '<mailto:email@email.com|email@email.com>';

It shows in there, but the NEXT button doesn't activate. If I click into the input box, the text disappears.  I believe this is because it is some sort of input that has data binding (react?) -- I notice when I inspect the DOM if I manually type in the address it updates the value attribute as I type it in.  I've tried focusing the input, changing value, then bluring, but that doesn't work as well.
Does anyone know of a way to manipulate this?  Is there an API for users that I could use for this?
I'm able to manipulate the rest of the items after I manually type in the email address. So this is kind of the thorn in my side at the moment.

If I was on the HubSpot side of things and I was wanting to test this I imagine you can do this with selenium and or whatever you test react inputs with -- but I can't seem to figure out how to do this with vanilla JS -- any help in this direction would be super beneficial

So far I've tried replacing the actual input field HTML with what it needs to be withe the value hardcoded. I probably need to replace it on the node level and not the html, but I'm too tired for that at the moment.  I've simulated typing by adding one letter at a time with a timeout to wait a small amount of time to fill each on in. In this current version I'm able to remove the disabled state and classes to allow the button to be clicked, but it is still not working <https://gist.github.com/NickDeckerDevs/4b1b9396ed1a80a4adcea9e34dde576b>
<@U25PYL3Q8> shared a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U25PYL3Q8/F9WFLT4A3/add_multiple_users_to_HubSpot.js|add_multiple_users_to_HubSpot.js>
holy shit I think I did it
